column4: how do i configure my servers so postfix stops asking me that useless goddamn question during upgrades
sorry for the rage, but this just killed an entire client's server of mine
postfix popped up its question during a headless upgrade, AFTER postgresql was shut down. doom.
when i provision a new server, the first thing i want to do is tell dpkg STOP ASKING ME ABOUT POSTFIX
thanks fofr that random pointless outburst, please don't do it again
it was above. (not very far above.)
it's asking you to configure postfix during the upgrade as it needs a response
it doesn't. postfix has a config file already. i set it up by hand during install. by even asking me that question, postfix is asking me whether i want to ruin my handmade config file
no isn't even an answer to the prompt, but the prompt itself is the problem
your only real option is to use response files
I've not done it for a long time, but that's what you need
looks like it's actually debconf-set-selections that i want! http://serverfault.com/questions/228266/how-do-i-generate-a-response-file-to-be-used-with-apt-get-or-aptitude
